definition: to express an opinion/to offer advice

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: This is probably one of the hardest times to think of ideas.
sentences.chinese: 大概目前也是最难想出点子的时候。

sentences.english: How do creative people come up with their ideas?
sentences.chinese: 有创造力的人如何想出点子？

sentences.english: ChuDianZi help the Kenyan extension sea conception has herod the birthday of the gift.
sentences.chinese: 阿公出点子帮著拓海构思有希的华诞礼物。
哈，他们负责帮爱德华出点子。

sentences.english: You do this by giving away free information, give great advice and generally being a nice person.
sentences.chinese: 通过提供免费信息，出点子，你逐渐成为受欢迎的人。

sentences.english: It wants ideas for a new TV programme.
sentences.chinese: 它需要为一个新的电视节目出点子。

definition: to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
collecting opinions is of wide benefit (idiom); to pool wisdom for mutual benefit/to profit from widespread suggestions
to use one's brains/to think
to resolve a difficult situation and leave worries behind (idiom)
to seek help from social connections
spot/point/dot/speck/drop (of liquid)/droplet/point (of argument)/idea/crux/indication/pointer
to help/to do a favor/(Shanghainese) Come on!/Give me a break!
to raise a tough question
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
to make a decision/to make up one's mind
to raise enough money to do sth/to pool money/to club together (to do sth)
to pay
to show sb how to get to the right path
to pool resources (for a gift, project etc)
enthusiasm/zeal/zealous/zest/enthusiastic/ardent/warmhearted
to help out
